website_summaries.verdict: The best overall anchor buoy to buy when you need larger sizes and a greater variety of options.
pros: One of the few buoys that offers larger sizes meant for heavy watercraft use in professional settings
Extra thick material prevents air leakages or catastrophic failures
cons: Buoy may require a high-capacity electric pump to get up to the appropriate air-pressure level

customer_reviews.title: Great for boxing and cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Great product if u wanna save money on the aqua bag! Make sure u push out all the air before u fill it with water! It works great for boxing! Love these for uppercuts
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Not great, zero customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Taylor buoys thinking these were a high quality option. Sadly they aren’t. You pay a premium price for a vinyl ball. Their ‘trivalve’ is stupidly difficult to inflate and one began leaking after 3 months. Called Taylor and their customer service was non-existent. Their warranty only covers rupture and they won’t help with a valve problem. Bought some Polyform balls to replace them and hopefully they work out better.
customer_reviews.author: Klrbee25

customer_reviews.title: Won’t inflate with rubber compressor nozzle
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fender with poor quality inflation valves. Instructions say you can inflate with a compressor nozzle (no needle) but I couldn’t get that to work on 3 of 4 I purchased. Get the “professional 3-piece basketball inflator” here on Amazon. Uses the typical basketball needle with the power and speed of a compressor. Also, 2 of 4 leaked at the valve. Customer Service sent replacements quickly, it this shouldn’t have happened.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Klein

customer_reviews.title: Get 1
customer_reviews.text: Beats the aqua bag water punch bag. Same product less $
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Picaso

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: These balls were easy to inflate using a compressor and they worked as expected protecting the boat from the concrete walls of the locks on the Erie Canal. I do intend to get larger ones for the future as 12” seemed a little on the small side.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: loses air
customer_reviews.text: i've had to reinflate mine every few weeks. It doesn't lose all of its air, it still floats, but it gets a bit deflated. Also, the white has gotten a bit of algae on it so if that bugs you, look for a different color because it really shows on the white.
customer_reviews.author: John GDC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Buoy
customer_reviews.text: These buoy's work great for my wakeboarding boat. I typically tie off next to my buddy's boat and ever since I bought these buoys, we haven't had any issues bumping boats. They're durable as heck too and easy to inflate/ deflate. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: I have destroyed 3 of these.
customer_reviews.text: I use these as water bags for club swinging practice. They break after a while, but they take a stupid amount of abuse before they do.
customer_reviews.author: Puddums

customer_reviews.title: Goood quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Sea Ray with a bigger stern. When tied up, my boat needs the extra cushion of the round.
customer_reviews.author: Kitesurfgirl

customer_reviews.title: good procuct & speedy delivery
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of the 12 inch bumpers and they work fine. I had trouble with one getting the plastic nozzle out because it got stripped. The 12 inch balls are a little small and I have since ordered and received a larger bumper from the same company. I really like the larger bumper for my 22' boat.
customer_reviews.author: Jim bec

customer_reviews.title: Great fenders!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fender balls on my boat. They are wide for fending off other boats rafted or against docks, but yet compact enough for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Hole in the seam
customer_reviews.text: Has a hole in the seam after three months of light use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Far too small for rougher water weekends on Lake of the Ozarks.
customer_reviews.text: Buoy holds up really well for rafting out on fairly calm water.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Tolly

customer_reviews.title: Quaility issue
customer_reviews.text: First one had a slow leak. Replacement works find and holds air for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Elmo

customer_reviews.title: great protection for the boat
customer_reviews.text: These are heavy duty and well constructed. Great price. These fenders offer maximun protection from docks or fafting up with other boats.
customer_reviews.author: AMAZONMIKE

customer_reviews.title: Tough and easy!!
customer_reviews.text: Seems well built and easy as a basketball to air up. Didn't see what was so difficult about airing them up as others have said. Pretty straight forward. Put needle in hole, add air.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: ... had holes in it and no valve what a waste of time what a joke
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this it had holes in it and no valve what a waste of time what a joke.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bhullar

customer_reviews.title: boat bouy
customer_reviews.text: the 12" bouy I recently purchased is perfect to keep my boat from rubbing on my dock.It is tuff and is just the right size for my purpose.I thought it would hamper myself and friends ,stepping between the dock and boat but is a perfect fit,and was also half the price of buying it at a local retailer.
customer_reviews.author: oscar russo

customer_reviews.title: Great buoy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality buoy and made in the USA. I purchased two of these last year for crabbing and they are great.
customer_reviews.author: compgeek

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but how do you fill it?
customer_reviews.text: A regular air pump with or without a needle does not appear to work to inflate this product well. It is very rugged and durable feeling though.
customer_reviews.author: smarquis

customer_reviews.title: Item leaks from pin hole in seem.
customer_reviews.text: This could be a great item. But it leaks. So that makes it hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Moore

customer_reviews.title: Taylor Made Tuff End
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Saving my pontoon from the dock scratches. I like Taylor made products because they last a long time. I've owned boats for most of my life. They just know how to do it right.
customer_reviews.author: C. Shipman

product_meta.title: Taylor Made Products 1143 Tuff End Inflatable Vinyl Boat Buoy, White, 12 inch Diameter
product_meta.description:
Heavy duty construction to meet the punishing demands of the commercial marine industry.

The most accurate way to select the right fender for your boat is to survey your docking area to find out what fender is in use for the same size and weight of boat, in terms of fender dimensions and quantities, and use that as a guideline.
feature_bullets: Made in the USA for heavy duty marine applications
Injection molded ends tested to 2000 psi tensile strength, featuring large line holes to fit most ropes and shackles
Tri-valve for easy inflation with football needle or compressor
Constructed from flexible and resilient marine grade vinyl
Tuff End fenders feature a seamless one piece construction, the strongest in the industry
